perturbation.original_text: Grant of Rights: Fox grants to Licensee a limited, non-exclusive right and license to distribute the following Wireless Products in connection with the Property “ICE AGE: THE MELTDOWN” in the United States: (A) 2 Scrat voicetones; (B) 2 John Leguizamo voicetones; and (C) 3 premium videos. Fox also grants Licensee a limited, non-exclusive right and license to distribute the following Wireless Products in connection with the Property “ICE AGE 2” outside of the United States: (A) 4 Scrat voicetones; (B) 1 John Leguizamo voicetone; and (C) 3 premium videos. (collectively, “IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products”)
perturbation.changed_text: Grant of Rights: Fox grants to Licensee a limited, non-exclusive right and license to distribute Wireless Products in connection with the Property “ICE AGE: THE MELTDOWN” in the United States and outside of the United States. The specific types and number of Wireless Products available for distribution shall be determined at Fox's sole discretion. (collectively, “IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products”)
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific number and type of wireless products (voicetones, videos) that the Licensee is permitted to distribute, the contract introduces ambiguity and potential for exploitation. Consumer protection laws, particularly advertising and fair trade regulations, often require clarity and accuracy in describing the products or services being offered. Omitting these specifics allows Fox to unilaterally change the offerings without clearly informing consumers. This violates consumer protection laws regarding accurate product descriptions.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various state and federal consumer protection laws regarding false advertising and unfair business practices (e.g., Section 5 of the Federal Trade Commission Act; California's Consumer Legal Remedies Act).

perturbation.original_text:
Royalty: In consideration of the rights granted to Licensee pursuant to this Amendment 2, Licensee shall pay to Fox, or such other party as Fox may designate in writing, a royalty in the following amount:
(a) From the first unit sold, Fox shall earn a royalty at the rate of ***** percent (*****%) of Licensee’s Gross Receipts (as defined in the Agreement) from Licensee’s sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products.(“IA2 Audio and Video Royalty”). For the avoidance of doubt, Licensee may not recoup any portion of the Ice Age 2 Guarantee (as defined in Amendment 1) through its sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products.
perturbation.changed_text: Royalty: In consideration of the rights granted to Licensee pursuant to this Amendment 2, Licensee shall pay to Fox a royalty. The specific royalty rate will be determined by Fox based on its internal policies and may be subject to change. Licensee may not recoup any portion of the Ice Age 2 Guarantee (as defined in Amendment 1) through its sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the specific royalty percentage (*****%) and replacing it with a clause stating that the royalty rate will be determined by Fox introduces significant legal risk. This violates consumer protection laws requiring transparency and predictability in financial terms. The original contract, even with the redacted percentage, at least acknowledges a defined method for calculating royalties. The modified version allows Fox to arbitrarily set and change the royalty rate, potentially exploiting the Licensee. This is a violation of good faith and fair dealing principles.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC) principles of good faith and fair dealing; State laws regarding unfair business practices.

perturbation.original_text: 3. No Direct-to-Consumer Distribution Royalty: Licensee shall not be entitled to receive a share of any revenues and shall have no claim to any revenues earned and collected by Fox, or a third-party Fox designates, for the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products which Fox distributes through its and its assigns’ direct-to-consumer distribution channels.
perturbation.changed_text: 3. No Direct-to-Consumer Distribution Royalty: Licensee shall not be entitled to receive a share of any revenues for the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products which Fox distributes through its direct-to-consumer distribution channels. Any claims regarding revenue sharing are subject to Fox's final determination.
perturbation.explanation: The phrase 'and shall have no claim to any revenues earned and collected by Fox, or a third-party Fox designates' has been shortened and 'Any claims regarding revenue sharing are subject to Fox's final determination.' has been added. By changing the original text and adding the additional text, the licensee's ability to dispute revenue earned by a third party has been significantly reduced and puts any potential claims at the sole discretion of Fox. This violates principles of fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles of fair dealing and good faith.
